pl.bristleback.server.bristle.serialization.system.converter

Class JsonTokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.bristleback.server.bristle.serialization.system.converter.JsonTokenizer

  • public class JsonTokenizer
extends Object
    This utility class contains methods for traversing through json text.

    Created on: 27.12.12 19:01

    Author:
    Wojciech Niemiec

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JsonTokenizer(String jsonAsText)
      Creates new tokenizer object operating on json given as parameter.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fastForwardValue()
      This method just reads entire value.
      int getIndex() 
      int getLastTokenBeginIndex() 
      JsonTokenType getLastTokenType()
      Gets last read token type.
      String getLastTokenValue()
      Gets last read token value.
      JsonTokenType nextToken()
      Takes next json token.
      String nextValueAsString()
      Reads next value as a String, regardless of whether the value is raw or complex type.
      void setNextReadRepeatedFromLast()
      Sets special flag that will point this tokenizer on nextToken() to return token that was previously read instead of taking next token.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonTokenizer

        public JsonTokenizer(String jsonAsText)
        Creates new tokenizer object operating on json given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        jsonAsText - json text.

    • Method Detail

      • setNextReadRepeatedFromLast

        public void setNextReadRepeatedFromLast()
        Sets special flag that will point this tokenizer on nextToken() to return token that was previously read instead of taking next token. After nextToken() method is invoked, the flag is set to false again (another nextToken() call will take the next token).

      • nextToken

        public JsonTokenType nextToken()
        Takes next json token. Last read token type can be retrieved using getLastTokenType() method. If read token is a value or property name, token value is stored and can be obtained using getLastTokenValue() method. If there is no more tokens, JsonTokenType.END_OF_JSON value is returned.
        Returns:
        type of last read token.

      • fastForwardValue

        public void fastForwardValue()
        This method just reads entire value. Can be used for example if this value should be omitted. All value types can be fast forwarded using this method (including arrays and objects).

      • nextValueAsString

        public String nextValueAsString()
        Reads next value as a String, regardless of whether the value is raw or complex type. For example, if value is of Object type {"property1":1}, this method will return {"property1":1}. This method may be usable if returned String will be processed by other json deserialization tool.
        Returns:
        next value as String.

      • getLastTokenValue

        public String getLastTokenValue()
        Gets last read token value. It returns not null value only if last read token type is one of the following types:
        • JsonTokenType.PROPERTY_NAME_OR_RAW_VALUE
        • JsonTokenType.PROPERTY_VALUE
        Returns:
        last read token value.

      • getLastTokenType

        public JsonTokenType getLastTokenType()
        Gets last read token type.
        Returns:
        last read token type.

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()

      • getLastTokenBeginIndex

        public int getLastTokenBeginIndex()
